channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside of the playground between Craik and Crone court, 4th February
item.description:
Lighting outside the playground isn’t lit making the green space completely dark which is often an attraction for ASB and crime

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Denmark Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Trip hazard,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Franklin Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass verges outside 149 welling way, 4th February
item.description:
The grass verges have been turned into a muddy mess by drivers turning their vehicles on them. This has been the case for a number of months. Please: - restore the verges to their undamaged condition - install bollards/posts in appropriate positions to stop vehicles being driven onto the verges Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 149, Welling Way, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tipping of a sofa, some plastic sheet and rubbish, 4th February
item.description:
It has been here for some time and despite two emails from our ward councillor and mayor Linda Bird on my behalf some time ago nothing has been done. Equally I spoke directly to two RBG employees who had a vehicle parked in Eltham Park Gardens who told me despite metres away from the problem they couldn’t move it because it wasn’t their area!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glenure Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo, 4th February
item.description:
A lady regularly pulls up in her red car opposite my house making it difficult to get onto our driveway and lets her dog run around the grass area off lead whilst she sits in her car, it poos and she never picks it up. This happens multiple times a day.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, The Green, Upper Belvedere, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on comms box in Westgate Rd, Beckenham, 4th February
item.description:
On the south-west corner of the crossroads where The Avenue and Westgate Road meet, there is a green comms box with number 29 on it. That is fine but there is also some graffiti on it. Please can the graffiti be removed.....thanks!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westgate Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Non stop fly tipping!, 4th February
item.description:
Every day the community centre dumps rubbish outside - as soon as the council clear it they just dump more (clear from the attached which property). They dumped some last night; it was cleared at lunch and before 7pm - more rubbish is dumped! (1st pic)

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Manor Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction of King Henry's Rd / Adelaide Rd, 4th February
item.description:
Turning left from KHRd into Adelaide Rd towards Swiss Cottage and there are a series of these stretching across Swiss Cottage to the junction of Hillgrove. I cannot understand why you leave a multitude of pot holes across the borough yet choose to burn money on bike lanes pavements and flower boxes You get a fortune from the motorist the least you could is fix the potholes and do a proper job instead of all the shoddy fixes
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Adelaide Road, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
